      • getIntegerChecked

        public int getIntegerChecked(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String errorMessage)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Get an integer from the configuration data

        If the parameter is not set a IllegalArgumentException will be thrown. If the data can not be parsed to an integer a NumberFormatException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the parameter to get
        errorMessage - the error message if the string is not set
        Returns:
        the value as integer
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        public long getLongChecked(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String errorMessage)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Get a long from the configuration data

        If the parameter is not set a IllegalArgumentException will be thrown. If the data can not be parsed to a long a NumberFormatException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the parameter to get
        errorMessage - the error message if the string is not set
        Returns:
        the value as long
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getStringNonEmpty

        public java.lang.String getStringNonEmpty(java.lang.String name)
        Get a non-empty string from the configuration.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the parameters to get
        Returns:
        returns null if the parameter is not set or is an empty string. Otherwise the string itself will be returned.

      • getPrefixed

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getPrefixed(java.lang.String prefix)
        Extracts attributes that start with a prefix and return the matching entries only with the key truncated by the prefix.

        If you want your prefix to be "prefix." you must also add the dot.

        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix to use
        Returns:
        the result map

      • getPrefixedProperties

        public java.util.Properties getPrefixedProperties(java.lang.String prefix)
        Convenience method to get prefixed attributes as Properties object

        Actually calls getPrefixed(String)

        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix to use
        Returns:
        the result properties
